message: I have an app that I want to send a welcome email once they create an account. Should I just send the message during that action or move that email task to something like resque?
is there any reason a user should be held up while you take care of the email?
a good rule of thumb is: If not instantly needed by the interface, a task should go into a background queue
Yea it is just an email saying that they have signed up to the service. I will move the email sending to a background queue. Thanks
@danest should probably look into queuing software like http://celeryproject.org/ which is used on this site but a very popular queuing software for a whole list of things
If you're running Amazon, they have a queue service

Do you have enough users that sending e-mail is slow? Remember, premature optimization is bad — and adding a queue turns a programming/UX problem into a systems one (do you have the necessary monitoring/sysadmin time to monitor the queue, etc).
Do you have enough users that sending e-mail is slow?
